discourse_list.title: Bounty payout request for Immunefi bug #5565

content.content: Since we don’t have the rapid payout process yet. I hereby request the following MIP64 payout in the next convenient spell (no rush): Recipient Address: 0x3C32F2ca11D92a7093d1F237161C1fB692F6a8eA Amount To Transfer: 2500 DAI Recipient Address: 0x2BC5fFc5De1a83a9e4cDDfA138bAEd516D70414b Amount To Transfer: 250 DAI  This was a Medium severity web vuln reported on Feb 10. The bug is fixed. @0xdeniz is working on a postmortem. The larger amount is going to the bug reporter. The smaller amount (10%) is for Immunefi. @TravinImmunefi @GovAlpha-Core-Unit
Does Immunefi have a page/link in relation to this bug or bounty payout? It would good to be able to provide more information when we include it in a spell.
A postmortem will be written, but I’m not sure when it will be published.
Can it be published prior to the payout, or no?
Yes please prior to the payout.

Ideally, it is published before the payout, but let’s not block a 2700 Dai payment if it’s not the case. We need the bounty hunters to know that Maker pays swiftly when a mistake is found. Maybe there’s a limit where we need the post-mortem beforehand? 10000 Dai? @psychonaut will probably have a better feel for the situation.

I’m not specifically asking for a full post-mortem in advance, but it would be nice to be able to include a link in the copy to a little bit more information beyond ‘there was a bug, the owner of this address fixed it so we’re sending them money’ Was it low severity, medium? Why is the reward going to two addresses? Was it a smart contract bug, or something with a website? The MIP also mentions that Immunefi charges a fee (10%?) per bug? Is this being distributed in the exec? Or is it just assumed that it will come from Immunefi’s budget?

LongForWisdom:  Was it low severity, medium?   It was a Medium web vuln reported on Feb 10. The bug is fixed. @0xdeniz is working on a postmortem.     LongForWisdom:  Why is the reward going to two addresses?   The larger amount is going to the bug reporter. As per MIP64, Immunefi receives 10% as payment.     LongForWisdom:  The MIP also mentions that Immunefi charges a fee (10%?) per bug? Is this being distributed in the exec?   Yeah, this is how it will happen (per MIP64) until we get the rapid payment process.
Gotcha, answered my own question there. Can you include this information in the initial post so people don’t need to go digging through the thread?
This topic was automatically closed 90 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
